::: {.cell hash='02_statistics_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_db02ce52890cbdb285809378a7a23e42'} ```{.r .cell-code} random_vars<-readRDS("C:/Users/mouni/Downloads/Causal_Data_Science_Data/Causal_Data_Science_Data/random_vars.rds") View(random_vars) ``` ::: 1. ::: {.cell hash='02_statistics_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_74ccca2c22e06d00127d806b710b1429'} ```{.r .cell-code} mean(random_vars$age) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> [1] 33.471 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} mean(random_vars$income) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> [1] 3510.731 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} var(random_vars) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> age income #> age 340.6078 29700.15 #> income 29700.1468 8625645.84 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} var(random_vars$income) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> [1] 8625646 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} sd(random_vars$age) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> [1] 18.45556 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} sd(random_vars$income) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> [1] 2936.945 ``` ::: ::: 2. Standard deviation is the square root of the variance and provides a measure of the average distance of data points from the mean. Comparing standard deviations makes sense when the variables are on similar scales. Higher standard deviations indicate greater variability. 3. ::: {.cell hash='02_statistics_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_aa338d2302814f166301a63497f5c032'} ```{.r .cell-code} cov(random_vars) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> age income #> age 340.6078 29700.15 #> income 29700.1468 8625645.84 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} cor(random_vars) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> age income #> age 1.0000000 0.5479432 #> income 0.5479432 1.0000000 ``` ::: ::: 4.Correlation is often easier to interpret as it is scaled between -1 and 1, making it independent of the scale of the variables. It indicates the strength and direction of a linear relationship. Covariance is in the units of the product of the two variables, making it sensitive to the scales. 5. ::: {.cell hash='02_statistics_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_7600273120cfde053a2ab1119418f4c0'} ```{.r .cell-code} aggregate(income ~ (age<=18), data=random_vars,FUN=mean) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
````` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} aggregate(income ~ (age>=18 & age<=65), data=random_vars,FUN=mean) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
````` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} aggregate(income ~ (age>=65), data=random_vars,FUN=mean) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
